main_definition: In a list of paired items, 'respectively' is used to indicate that the corresponding elements are related in the order mentioned.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To correspond or relate with something else in order
meanings_and_examples.example: John and Mary got A and B grades respectively, meaning John got an A and Mary got a B.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In numerical data sets, it is used to indicate the relationship between two corresponding elements
meanings_and_examples.example: The numbers 25 and 30 are prime, respectively.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used when referring to a sequence of pairs or groups that have specific relationships with each other in order
meanings_and_examples.example: The twins were born on May 1st and June 15th, respectively. This means the first twin was born on May 1st and the second on June 15th.
